bug.author: ThiagoLira
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
The training loop on the example yields an error. <denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
Just copy the code from <denchmark-link:https://gpytorch.readthedocs.io/en/latest/examples/01_Exact_GPs/Simple_GP_Regression.html>https://gpytorch.readthedocs.io/en/latest/examples/01_Exact_GPs/Simple_GP_Regression.html</denchmark-link>
** Stack trace/error message ** /usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gpytorch/utils/pivoted_cholesky.py in woodbury_factor(low_rank_mat, shift) 100 shifted_mat = shifted_mat + torch.eye(k, dtype=shifted_mat.dtype, device=shifted_mat.device) 101 --> 102 R = torch.potrs(low_rank_mat, torch.cholesky(shifted_mat, upper=True)) 103 return R 104 AttributeError: module 'torch' has no attribute 'potrs' <denchmark-h:h2>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
Model trains without further errors. <denchmark-h:h2>System information</denchmark-h>
Please complete the following information:
GPyTorch Version 1.0.0 PyTorch Version 1.3.1 Computer OS MacOS Catalina

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ThiagoLira>@ThiagoLira</denchmark-link> -- you are running on an old (from the look of the stack trace, very old) version of GPyTorch (which admittedly would probably work if you had a comparably old version of torch). Could you make sure that your install procedure actually installed 1.0.0? The line referenced in your stack trace does not even exist in the codebase anymore :-).

Oh, sorry... I should have suspected when print(gpytorch.version) didn't work haha pip definitely thinks that this is version 1.0.0. I'm using a fresh python3.7 env via virtualenv <denchmark-code>(deepfact) Thiagos-MacBook-Pro ~ $ pip install gpytorch Collecting gpytorch Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/e2/d9/796c53bffa43aa099bb7bbdbb7bf50e294ec9033e0b2a9df714fc6991b88/gpytorch-1.0.0.tar.gz (232kB) |‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà| 235kB 5.8MB/s Building wheels for collected packages: gpytorch Building wheel for gpytorch (setup.py) ... done Created wheel for gpytorch: filename=gpytorch-1.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl size=390233 sha256=fe004a5aeee378f3d688e82db7bb042a72671c9b97d8cf70563a7cd23561d039 Stored in directory: /Users/thiagolira/Library/Caches/pip/wheels/cb/cd/72/b8c3f9a71d0df1e07d8d2b3d3e47155825eae45e13a8e58d2a Successfully built gpytorch Installing collected packages: gpytorch Successfully installed gpytorch-1.0.0 </denchmark-code>
If I use <denchmark-code>pip install --upgrade git+https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch.git </denchmark-code>
It then installs gpytorch 0.3.6.

The problem vanishes when I run the script outside of jupyter lab. It must be using the wrong kernel although I'm pretty sure I've set it up correctly. You never know with python <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11686042/72103831-cec51980-3308-11ea-868c-34f8a63f6788.png></denchmark-link>
I'm closing the issue since this is my messy envs fault. Sorry for bothering you!
